00022 #define AFCGI_VERSION 1
00023 #define AFCGI_HEADER_LEN  8
00024 #define AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE (1<<16)
00025 
00026 /** The names of the different callbacks */
00027 enum afcgi_callback_names {
00028         /** Called when all headers was received */
00029         ON_HEADERS = 0,
00030         /** Called when STDIN stream packet was ready */
00031         ON_RECEIVE,
00032         /** Called when DATA stream packet was ready */
00033         ON_DATA_RECV,
00034         /** Called when all STDIN packets was sent */
00035         ON_RUN,
00036         /** Called when all DATA packets was sent */
00037         ON_END_OF_DATA,
00038         /** Called when application can write on STDIN, STDERR */
00039         ON_WRITE,
00040         /** Called when server sent abort */
00041         ON_ABORT
00042 };
00043 
00044 /** return status */
00045 enum afcgi_return_status {
00046         /** normal end of request. */
00047         AFCGI_REQUEST_COMPLETE = 0,
00048 
00049         /** 
00050          * rejecting a new request. This happens when a Web server sends concurrent
00051          * requests over one connection to an application that is designed to
00052          * process one request at a time per connection.
00053          */
00054         AFCGI_CANT_MPX_CONN    = 1,
00055 
00056         /**
00057          * rejecting a new request. This happens when the application runs out of
00058          * some resource, e.g. database connections.
00059          */
00060         AFCGI_OVERLOADED       = 2,
00061 
00062         /**
00063          * rejecting a new request. This happens when the Web server has
00064          * specified a role that is unknown to the application.
00065          */
00066         AFCGI_UNKNOWN_ROLE     = 3
00067 };

00069 struct afcgi_sess;
00070 struct afcgi;

00072 /** 
00073  * used for standard afcgi callbacks
00074  * @param s   is afcgi session
00075  * @param arg is easy argument
00076  */
00077 typedef void (*afcgi_cb)(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg);
00078 
00079 /** 
00080  * used for standard afcgi input callbacks
00081  * @param s    is afcgi session
00082  * @param arg  is easy argument
00083  * @param len  is data length
00084  */
00085 typedef void (*afcgi_cb_data)(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg,
00086                               int len);

00088 struct afcgi_hdr {
00089         char *name;
00090         int name_len;
00091         char *value;
00092         int value_len;
00093         struct afcgi_hdr *next;
00094 };
00095 
00096 struct afcgi_sess {
00097         uint16_t request_id;
00098         struct {
00099                 uint16_t role;
00100                 uint8_t  flags;
00101                 uint8_t  reserved[5];
00102         } h;
00103         char *head;
00104         struct afcgi_hdr *hdr;
00105         enum afcgi_return_status return_status;
00106         int rc;
00107 
00108         // call backs
00109         void *arg;
00110         afcgi_cb on_headers;
00111         afcgi_cb_data on_receive;
00112         afcgi_cb_data on_data_recv;
00113         afcgi_cb on_end_of_data;
00114         afcgi_cb on_run;
00115         afcgi_cb on_abort;
00116         afcgi_cb_data on_write;
00117 
00118         // links
00119         struct afcgi *afcgi;
00120         struct afcgi_sess *write_next;
00121         struct afcgi_sess *write_prev;
00122         struct afcgi_sess *end_next;
00123 };
00124 
00125 struct afcgi {
00126         int fd;
00127         int s;
00128         struct { // current header
00129                 uint8_t  version;
00130                 uint8_t  type;
00131                 uint16_t request_id;
00132                 uint16_t content_len;
00133                 uint8_t  padding_len;
00134                 uint8_t  reserved;
00135         } c;
00136         char *head;
00137         struct afcgi_binder *binder;
00138         struct afcgi_sess *sess[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00139 
00140         // read
00141         char buffer[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00142         char *buff;
00143         int buff_len;
00144 
00145         // write
00146         struct afcgi_sess *write;
00147         struct rotbuffer buff_wr;
00148         char buffer_write[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00149 
00150         // end
00151         struct afcgi_sess *end;
00152 };
00153 
00154 struct afcgi_binder {
00155         int fd;
00156         void *arg;
00157         afcgi_cb on_new;
00158 };

00160 /**
00161  * init fcgi internals and poller system
00162  * @param maxconn The maximun of connection expected (all sockets)
00163  *                -1: use the max limit (ulimit -n)
00164  *                >0: use this value, ans set limit
00165  * @param tm      The timeout tree pointer from lib events
00166  */
00167 void afcgi_init(int maxconn, struct ev_timeout_basic_node *tm);
00168 
00169 /**
00170  * Bind network address or socket 
00171  * @param bind   network address or socket (or NULL for stdin)
00172  * @param on_new callback called for new connexion
00173  * @param arg    easy arg 
00174  * @return if ok return 0, else return < 0
00175  */
00176 int afcgi_bind(char *bind, afcgi_cb on_new, void *arg);
00177 
00178 /**
00179  * afcgi main loop. This launched the main loop after initialization
00180  * @param loop (boolean) 0: the function return,
00181  *                       1: the function never return
00182  */
00183 void afcgi_loop(int loop);

00186  * set easy argument
00187  * @param s fascgi session identifier
00188  * @param arg easy argument
00189  */
00190 static inline void afcgi_set_arg(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg) { s->arg = arg; }

00192 /**
00193  * set callback
00194  * @param sess fascgi session identifier
00195  * @param name callback name
00196  * @param cb calback pointer
00197  */
00198 #define afcgi_set_callback(sess, name, cb) afcgi_set_cb_ ## name(sess, cb)
00199 
00200 static inline void 
00201 afcgi_set_cb_ON_HEADERS(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00202         s->on_headers = cb;
00203 }
00204 static inline void 
00205 afcgi_set_cb_ON_RECEIVE(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00206         s->on_receive = cb;
00207 }
00208 static inline void 
00209 afcgi_set_cb_ON_DATA_RECV(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00210         s->on_receive = cb;
00211 }
00212 static inline void 
00213 afcgi_set_cb_ON_WRITE(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00214         s->on_write = cb;
00215 }
00216 static inline void 
00217 afcgi_set_cb_ON_RUN(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00218         s->on_run = cb;
00219 }
00220 static inline void 
00221 afcgi_set_cb_ON_END_OF_DATA(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00222         s->on_end_of_data = cb;
00223 }
00224 static inline void 
00225 afcgi_set_cb_ON_ABORT(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00226         s->on_abort = cb;

00229 /**
00230  * search header
00231  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00232  * @param name header name (case insensitive
00233  * @return header if found, NULL if not found
00234  */
00235 static inline struct afcgi_hdr *
00236 afcgi_search_header(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *name) {
00237         struct afcgi_hdr *h;
00238 
00239         for (h = s->hdr; h != NULL; h = h->next)
00240                 if(strcasecmp(name, h->name) == 0)
00241                         return h;
00242         return NULL;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /**
00246  * search header, return string format
00247  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00248  * @param name header name (case insensitive
00249  * @return char *header if found, NULL if not found
00250  */
00251 static inline char *
00252 afcgi_search_header_str(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *name) {
00253         struct afcgi_hdr *h;
00254 
00255         h = afcgi_search_header(s, name);
00256         if (h == NULL)
00257                 return NULL;
00258         return h->value;
00259 }
00260 
00261 /**
00262  * afcgi session want's write
00263  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00264  */
00265 void afcgi_want_write(struct afcgi_sess *s);
00266 
00267 /**
00268  * afcgi session do not write more
00269  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00270  */
00271 void afcgi_stop_write(struct afcgi_sess *s);
00272 
00273 /**
00274  * write data
00275  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00276  * @param buff buffer
00277  * @param len buffer len
00278  * @return size writed
00279  */
00280 static inline int afcgi_write(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *buff, int len) {
00281         return rotbuffer_read_buff(&s->afcgi->buff_wr, buff, len);
00282 }
00283 
00284 /**
00285  * afcgi session end
00286  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00287  * @param rs return status
00288  * @param rc return code
00289  */
00290 void afcgi_end(struct afcgi_sess *s, enum afcgi_return_status rs, int rc);

00292 /* log priority.
00293  * the same level that syslog
00294  */
00295 #ifndef LOG_EMERG
00296 /** log emergency */
00297 #       define LOG_EMERG       0
00298 #endif
00299 
00300 #ifndef LOG_ALERT
00301 /** log alert */
00302 #       define LOG_ALERT       1
00303 #endif
00304 
00305 #ifndef LOG_CRIT
00306 /** log critical */
00307 #       define LOG_CRIT        2
00308 #endif
00309 
00310 #ifndef LOG_ERR
00311 /** log error */
00312 #       define LOG_ERR         3
00313 #endif
00314 
00315 #ifndef LOG_WARNING
00316 /** log warning */
00317 #       define LOG_WARNING     4
00318 #endif
00319 
00320 #ifndef LOG_NOTICE
00321 /** log notice */
00322 #       define LOG_NOTICE      5
00323 #endif
00324 
00325 #ifndef LOG_INFO
00326 /** log info */
00327 #       define LOG_INFO        6
00328 #endif
00329 
00330 #ifndef LOG_DEBUG
00331 /** log debug */
00332 #       define LOG_DEBUG       7
00333 #endif
00334 
00335 #ifndef AFCGI_MAX_LOG_LEVEL
00336 /**
00337  * all debug logs with level > AFCGI_MAX_LOG_LEVEL are not compiled
00338  * redifine this define with compilation option for build binary in
00339  * debug mode or in normal mode
00340  */
00341 #       define AFCGI_MAX_LOG_LEVEL LOG_WARNING
00342 #endif
00343 
00344 /** 
00345  * send log message.
00346  * is recomended to use for compilation code simplification
00347  *
00348  * @param priority log level from LOG_DEBUG to LOG_EMERG
00349  * @param fmt log format: ex: "open file %s"
00350  * @param args... args for log format
00351  */
00352 #define afcgi_logmsg(priority, fmt, args...) \
00353         do { \
00354                 if ( (priority) <= AFCGI_MAX_LOG_LEVEL ) { \
00355                         __afcgi_logmsg((priority), \
00356                               __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ##args); \
00357                 } \
00358         } while(0)
00359 
00360 /** 
00361  * send log message.
00362  * is recomended to use macro
00363  *
00364  * @param priority log level from LOG_DEBUG to LOG_EMERG
00365  * @param file code filename
00366  * @param function code function
00367  * @param line code line
00368  * @param fmt log format: ex: "open file %s"
00369  * @param args args for log format
00370  */
00371 void __afcgi_logmsg(int priority, const char *file,
00372                     const char *function, int line, char *fmt, ...);

00374 
00375 #define AFCGI_LOG_STDERR        0x00000001
00376 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_FUNCTION  0x00000004
00377 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_FILE      0x00000010
00378 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_LINE      0x00000020
00379 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_HOSTNAME  0x00000040
00380 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_APP_NAME  0x00000080
00381 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_PID       0x00000100
00382 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_TIME      0x00000200
00383 #define AFCGI_LOG_SYSLOG        0x00000400
00384 #define AFCGI_LOG_DSP_LOG_LEVEL 0x00001000
00385 
00386 /** 
00387  * set log modes
00388  * 
00389  * @param flags:  can takes this values:
00390  *
00391  *  - AFCGI_LOG_STDERR log on stderr output
00392  *  - AFCGI_LOG_SYSLOG log on syslog, this option require 3 parameters
00393  *     - (char *) program name (generally the same AFCGI_LOG_DSP_APP_NAME)
00394  *     - (int) log pid ? : 1=>yes, 0=>no
00395  *     - (int) the facility code:
00396  *         - LOG_KERN     : kernel messages 
00397  *         - LOG_USER     : random user-level messages 
00398  *         - LOG_MAIL     : mail system 
00399  *         - LOG_DAEMON   : system daemons 
00400  *         - LOG_AUTH     : security/authorization messages 
00401  *         - LOG_SYSLOG   : messages generated internally by syslogd 
00402  *         - LOG_LPR      : line printer subsystem 
00403  *         - LOG_NEWS     : network news subsystem 
00404  *         - LOG_UUCP     : UUCP subsystem 
00405  *         - LOG_CRON     : clock daemon 
00406  *         - LOG_AUTHPRIV : security/authorization messages (private) 
00407  *         - LOG_FTP      : ftp daemon 
00408  *         - LOG_LOCAL0   : reserved for local use 
00409  *         - LOG_LOCAL1   : reserved for local use 
00410  *         - LOG_LOCAL2   : reserved for local use 
00411  *         - LOG_LOCAL3   : reserved for local use 
00412  *         - LOG_LOCAL4   : reserved for local use 
00413  *         - LOG_LOCAL5   : reserved for local use 
00414  *         - LOG_LOCAL6   : reserved for local use 
00415  *         - LOG_LOCAL7   : reserved for local use 
00416  *
00417  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_LOG_LEVEL display only loglevel upper than the parameter.
00418  *                            This option require 1 parameter: 
00419  *     - (int) loglevel. default: LOG_WARNING
00420  *
00421  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_TIME      display time in log
00422  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_HOSTNAME  display hostname in log
00423  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_APP_NAME  display application name in log.
00424  *                            This option require 1 parameter
00425  *     - (char *) application name
00426  *
00427  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_PID       display application pid in log
00428  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_FUNCTION: log msg function name (generally used for debug)
00429  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_FILE:     log msg filename (generally used for debug)
00430  *  - AFCGI_LOG_DSP_LINE:     log msg line (generallyused for debug)
00431  */
00432 void afcgi_set_log_opt(uint32_t flags, ...);
00433 
00434 #endif
